page.title: 13Chickney, recreation & clubs
page.content: Some of the landowners keep horses for riding but there are no stables where horses can be hired for this purpose. Game is preserved on some farm land for the shooting of pheasants and partridges. There is also rough shooting of pigeons hares and rabbits on farms in the area. Banger racing in old cars takes place in the NW of the area regularly. For members of the Caravan Club of GB there is a site at Staines Farm. The Saffroin Walden Rugby Football Club has a sportsground in the Sibleys area. Two houses have private swimming pools and a lot of people enjoy gardening and walking, the latter usually with a dog as most households have one or more dogs. We note a Cutler's Green Womens' Institute.
